global_buying_rules: Prefer third-party tested (USP/NSF/Informed Choice) OR a batch COA showing heavy metals + microbiology.
Avoid proprietary blends. Demand exact dose per serving in mg/g/IU/FU/mcg.
Match clinically relevant forms: Mg glycinate/bisglycinate; K2 as MK-7; omega-3 by EPA+DHA grams; nattokinase by FU; UC-II 40 mg; shilajit purified with metals testing.
Botanicals must be standardized to actives (withanolides/eurycomanone/fulvic acids/crocins/bacosides). If not, default to 'skip'.
High-variance categories require extra quality policing: melatonin (esp gummies), shilajit, enzymes, exotic 'test boosters'.

bleeding_risk_or_blood_thinners_or_surge.reason: May increase bleeding risk or affect clotting pathways; requires clinician supervision.

serotonergic_meds.reason: Risk of serotonin toxicity or excessive monoamine activity with medication combinations.

pregnancy_breastfeeding.reason: Insufficient safety; avoid hormone-modulating / potent neuroactive / fibrinolytic agents.

kidney_disease.reason: Electrolyte handling and renal clearance concerns; medical review advised.

dose_range.note: TG-lowering territory; prefer prescription-grade when hyperTG

ingredients.mechanism: Membrane lipid remodeling + pro-resolving mediators; dose-dependent triglyceride reduction by lowering hepatic VLDL output.
label_check: Must list grams of EPA+DHA (not 'fish oil 1000 mg').
Prefer IFOS/COA with oxidation metrics if available.
risks: Fishy reflux/GI; bleeding risk rises with higher doses esp with anticoagulants.
interactions: Anticoagulants/antiplatelets: caution; surgery: stop per clinician.
refs: AHA Science Advisory (2019); NIH ODS Omega-3 Fact Sheet

ingredients.mechanism: Polyphenols may modulate lipid metabolism and oxidative stress; effect is product-quality sensitive.
label_check: Require standardized polyphenols/flavonoids; avoid vague 'bergamot powder 1000 mg'.
risks: GI in some; variable quality across brands.

ingredients.mechanism: Compete with intestinal cholesterol absorption → LDL reduction (best with meals).
label_check: Dose must be in grams per day; avoid fairy-dust blends.
risks: May slightly reduce carotenoid absorption—pair with colorful veg.

ingredients.mechanism: Viscous fiber reduces bile acid reabsorption → LDL support; improves glycemic excursions; supports regularity (estrogen clearance angle).
label_check: Look for pure husk powder; drink water; separate from meds by 2+ hours.
risks: Bloating if ramped too fast.
interactions: May reduce absorption of meds/supps—separate timing.

dose_range.note: common studied range; higher = more bleeding risk

ingredients.mechanism: Fibrinolytic enzyme activity; supports thrombus breakdown pathways; evidence mixed but plausible.
label_check: Dose must be FU; prefer reputable standardization; avoid if on blood thinners unless clinician ok.
risks: Bleeding risk; stop pre-surgery.
refs: Recent reviews/RCT summaries on nattokinase; unit FU is critical

dose_range.note: Doses vary by product activity units; engine requires product-specific units

ingredients.mechanism: Fibrinolytic enzyme; evidence mostly small trials, often adjunctive; heterogeneity is high.
label_check: Require activity units and clinical standardization; avoid sketchy sourcing.
risks: Bleeding risk possible; allergy risk (biologic).
refs: Systematic review (2025) notes heterogeneity and limits

ingredients.mechanism: Mitochondrial electron transport + antioxidant support; often used in statin-associated symptoms context.
label_check: Prefer ubiquinol if older/absorption issues; oil softgel improves absorption.

dose_range.note: Engine default: avoid high-dose vitamin E for CV due to hemorrhagic stroke signal

ingredients.mechanism: High-dose vitamin E shows differential stroke subtype effects; hemorrhagic stroke risk increased in meta-analysis.
label_check: Engine default: avoid megadoses unless specific indication + clinician oversight.
risks: Bleeding/hemorrhagic stroke risk signal at supplementation doses.

dose_range.note: Engine default: avoid for outcomes; trial showed no CV benefit + more adverse events

ingredients.mechanism: Outcome trials (e.g., HPS2-THRIVE) show no major vascular benefit when added to statins and increased serious adverse events.
label_check: If used, must be clinician-directed with liver/glucose monitoring; otherwise avoid.
risks: Flushing, liver risk, glucose dysregulation, bleeding/infection signals in large trial.

dose_range.note: Units vary; evidence inconsistent; engine treats as advanced with caution

ingredients.mechanism: Proteolytic enzyme marketed for inflammation; enteric protection improves gastric stability; clinical evidence is inconsistent and long-term safety unclear.
label_check: Prefer enteric-coated products; demand activity units and reputable manufacturing; avoid if bleeding risk.
risks: Bleeding risk possible; GI upset.
refs: Enteric stability studies; reviews noting limited evidence

ingredients.mechanism: Supports endothelial function and modest BP/lipid effects; also antiplatelet tendency at higher doses.
label_check: Prefer aged garlic extract with S-allyl cysteine (SAC) standardization; avoid 'garlic powder'.
risks: Bleeding tendency in some; GI.

forms: beetroot juice powder standardized for nitrates
ingredients.mechanism: Raises NO availability → vasodilation and performance; may support BP in some responders.
label_check: Must declare nitrate content; raw beet powders often underpowered.
risks: GI; red urine/stool (benign).

ingredients.mechanism: Osmoregulation, calcium handling, and GABA/glycine tone; may support BP and relaxation.
label_check: Pure powder/caps; avoid energy drink confounds.

ingredients.mechanism: Methyl donor supporting homocysteine remethylation; osmolyte; can support training performance in some.
label_check: Dose in grams; many products underdose.
risks: Fishy body odor in rare high responders.
interactions: If using multiple methyl donors (high folate/B12/SAMe), start low.

ingredients.mechanism: Arginine precursor → NO pathway support; perf and vascular tone support.
label_check: If citrulline malate, must state ratio (2:1 etc).

ingredients.mechanism: AMPK signaling; glycemic and lipid improvements in some trials; interacts with drug metabolism.
label_check: Dose must be real; avoid underdosed blends.
risks: GI; constipation/diarrhea.
interactions: Interacts with many meds (CYP/P-gp); pregnancy: avoid.

ingredients.mechanism: Cartilage matrix support; symptomatic benefit in some OA subgroups; response varies.
label_check: Prefer sulfate form; avoid underdosed blends.
interactions: Warfarin/coumarins: INR interaction reports—avoid unless supervised.
refs: Meta-analyses and interaction reports; INR case reports

ingredients.mechanism: Supports cartilage hydration and anti-catabolic signaling; mixed evidence but can help OA symptoms.
label_check: Ensure true chondroitin mg; not 'joint complex' fluff.
refs: Knee OA trial/meta-analyses; warfarin interaction signals

forms: sodium hyaluronate (oral) low-MW or specified MW

dose_range.note: evidence varies by MW; product quality matters

ingredients.mechanism: May support joint comfort and function; oral evidence growing but still variable; MW may matter.
label_check: Prefer brands stating MW + dose clearly; avoid tiny-dosed cosmetics-style products.

dose_range.note: daily; or 10–15 g pre-loading with vitamin C before tendon loading

ingredients.mechanism: Provides glycine/proline/hydroxyproline building blocks; can reduce joint pain and support connective tissue remodeling with training stimulus.
label_check: Look for grams per serving; many products underdose massively.
refs: RCTs and recent meta-analyses in knee OA

ingredients.mechanism: Immune tolerance signaling (different mechanism than peptides).
label_check: Must explicitly say 'undenatured type II' and 40 mg.

ingredients.mechanism: Sulfur donor; may reduce pain/stiffness and oxidative stress in some OA data.
label_check: Pure MSM is fine; dose is in grams not milligrams.

ingredients.mechanism: NF-κB / inflammatory pathway modulation; can improve pain/function in OA contexts.
label_check: Prefer delivery systems; avoid raw powder unless huge dose.

ingredients.mechanism: 5-LOX pathway modulation; anti-inflammatory support for joint comfort.
label_check: Require AKBA or equivalent standardization.

dose_range.note: muscle protection/recovery; joint indirectly via tissue tolerance

ingredients.mechanism: May reduce muscle damage and improve recovery in some; indirect joint load tolerance benefit via better tissue resilience.
label_check: Look for 3 g/day total; avoid tiny blends.

ingredients.mechanism: Proteolytic enzyme; anti-inflammatory and edema modulation in some contexts.
label_check: Prefer enzyme activity units (GDU/MCU).
risks: Bleeding risk mild; allergy.

ingredients.mechanism: Methyl donor; can improve mood and OA pain in some trials; can be activating.
label_check: Stabilized SAMe form; enteric-coated often used.
risks: Anxiety/insomnia at higher doses.
interactions: SSRIs/MAOIs: caution; bipolar: avoid without clinician.

dose_range.note: aim: metabolism shift more than hard suppression

ingredients.mechanism: Shifts estrogen metabolite pathways (2-OH vs 16-OH). Not a pharmaceutical aromatase inhibitor.
label_check: Avoid tiny 25 mg products; look for meaningful dose + clean excipients.
risks: If E2 drops too far: libido/mood/joints may worsen.

ingredients.mechanism: Supports glucuronidation and clearance pathways (evidence limited but plausible).
label_check: Dose must be real; many caps are small.

cycle.notes: Use short blocks if goal is E2/free T modulation; reassess.

ingredients.mechanism: May influence SHBG/free T and inflammatory markers; short human data suggest E2 down and free T up, but extrapolation cautious.
label_check: Avoid mega-dose long term by default.

dose_range.note: if chronic >25 mg add copper 1–2 mg unless contraindicated

ingredients.mechanism: Supports androgen signaling and overall endocrine function (especially if deficient).
label_check: Must list ELEMENTAL zinc. If zinc ≥25 mg for >4–6 weeks, consider copper.
risks: Nausea; copper deficiency risk if high-dose long-term.

ingredients.mechanism: Precursor that can convert to DIM-like compounds; supports estrogen metabolite shifts.
label_check: Avoid random cabbage powders; use standardized.

ingredients.mechanism: Adaptogenic signaling; meta-analyses show reduced stress/anxiety and lower cortisol levels in several trials.
label_check: Require standardized withanolides; avoid random powders.
risks: GI; rare liver issues reported; quality matters.
refs: NIH ODS Ashwagandha fact sheet; recent meta-analyses

ingredients.mechanism: Stress response modulation; often used for evening cortisol flattening and sleep quality support.
label_check: Must be actual PS mg (not 'lecithin complex').

ingredients.mechanism: Promotes relaxed alertness; can reduce stress reactivity and improve sleep quality in some users.
label_check: Simple label; avoid blends that hide dosing.
risks: Too sedating mentally in some at higher doses.

ingredients.mechanism: Adaptogen that may improve fatigue and stress tolerance; can feel 'stimmy' if overdosed.
label_check: Require rosavins/salidroside standardization.
risks: Anxiety/insomnia if taken late or too high.

dose_range.note: elemental Mg; more for cognition/sleep feel than laxative forms

ingredients.mechanism: Mg form marketed for CNS penetration; evidence mixed; some prefer for calm focus.
label_check: Check ELEMENTAL Mg; many labels hide it.

ingredients.mechanism: Steroid-hormone-like signaling; supports endocrine, immune, and mood functions; deficiency correction is high ROI.
label_check: Prefer oil-based softgel/drop; avoid mega-dose long-term without labs.

dose_range.note: pairs with D3 in many protocols

ingredients.mechanism: Supports calcium handling (vascular/bone axis).
label_check: Must specify MK-7 micrograms; avoid vague 'K2 complex'.
interactions: Warfarin: do not use without clinician supervision.

ingredients.mechanism: Relaxation and neuromuscular support; modest insomnia improvements in RCTs; supports endocrine function if deficient.
label_check: Label must state ELEMENTAL magnesium mg.
risks: Loose stool if too high; kidney disease caution.
refs: RCT with 250 mg elemental magnesium for insomnia (2025)

cycle.notes: Cycle to reduce habituation and side effects; avoid late dosing.

ingredients.mechanism: May improve stress hormone profile and support testosterone in some men, especially with stress/high cortisol context.
label_check: Non-negotiable: standardized extract (many products are just root powder).
risks: Irritability or sleep disruption if overdosed.

dose_range.note: often split; RCT used 250 mg twice daily

ingredients.mechanism: May increase total and free testosterone and DHEAS in some human trials; quality is everything due to contamination risk.
label_check: Require COA for heavy metals + fulvic acid standardization.
risks: Heavy metals if low-quality; avoid without testing.

ingredients.mechanism: Traditionally used for energy/libido; limited human data; treat as advanced add-on with quality checks.
label_check: Require standardized actives; avoid random powder.
risks: Overstimulation in sensitive users.

dose_range.note: libido/energy support more than serum T

ingredients.mechanism: More libido/energy and mood support than direct testosterone elevation; can help subjective performance.
label_check: Prefer gelatinized maca for digestion; avoid proprietary blends.

ingredients.mechanism: Mostly animal data; human safety and dosing not established.
label_check: Default avoid.
risks: Unknown toxicity and endocrine disruption potential.

dose_range.note: training days; androgen receptor support claims in some data

ingredients.mechanism: May support recovery and androgen receptor content in some contexts; also improves muscle damage markers.
label_check: Dose in grams; avoid tiny capsules unless multiple.

ingredients.mechanism: Promotes sleep quality partly via thermoregulation and inhibitory signaling; human studies use 3 g before bedtime.
label_check: Pure powder; easy dosing.

dose_range.note: micro-dose for circadian support; avoid chronic high-dose

ingredients.mechanism: Circadian phase support and sleep onset; OTC products can be wildly mislabeled; prioritize tested brands and low dose.
label_check: Prefer USP/NSF/third-party tested; avoid gummies unless tested; start at 0.1–0.3 mg.
risks: Grogginess/vivid dreams; tolerance-like effects if abused; label variance risk.
refs: Erland & Saxena 2017 content variability; NCCIH melatonin advisory

ingredients.mechanism: Flavone with GABAergic calming properties (evidence moderate; often anecdotal-driven).
label_check: Avoid blends hiding dose.
risks: Sedation; interactions possible with sedatives.

ingredients.mechanism: Anxiolytic effect in some trials; can improve sleep via anxiety reduction.
label_check: Prefer standardized oral lavender oil products.
risks: GI/burps in some.

ingredients.mechanism: GABAergic calming; evidence mixed but can help sleep onset in some.
label_check: Prefer extracts with valerenic acid info; avoid blends hiding dose.
risks: Next-day grogginess in some.

ingredients.mechanism: Calming herb; anxiety-sleep overlap tool; often pairs with theanine/magnesium.
label_check: Require rosmarinic acid standardization when possible.

ingredients.mechanism: Cholinergic + phospholipid support; often cleaner than alpha-GPC for some.
label_check: Dose must be clear; avoid blends.
risks: Headache if too cholinergic.

dose_range.note: use-case specific; caution with CV risk

ingredients.mechanism: Potent choline donor; performance/cognition benefits for some. Observational data linked alpha‑GPC use to higher incident stroke risk in one cohort; newer data are mixed.
label_check: Avoid chronic daily use by default; prefer CDP-choline when possible; caution if CV risk high.
risks: Headache, cholinergic side effects; potential vascular risk association.
refs: JAMA Network Open cohort 2021; later studies mixed

cycle.notes: Avoid continuous long-term use; watch vivid dreams/bradycardia.

ingredients.mechanism: Acetylcholinesterase inhibition (strong). Useful for specific cognitive targets but easy to overshoot.
label_check: Microgram dosing; must be cycled.
risks: Nausea, vivid dreams, bradycardia in sensitive users.

ingredients.mechanism: Catecholamine precursor; best as an acute tool for stress resilience and performance under sleep loss.
label_check: Prefer L-tyrosine over NALT unless specific rationale.
risks: Anxiety/BP up in sensitive users.

ingredients.mechanism: D-isomer may affect endorphin/enkephalin breakdown; L-isomer is catecholamine precursor. Can boost drive but can overstimulate.
label_check: Start low; avoid if anxious or hypertensive.
risks: Anxiety, insomnia.
interactions: MAOI meds: avoid; serotonergic stacks: caution.

dose_range.note: as L-DOPA equivalent; cycle; high caution

cycle.notes: Use only for specific targets; monitor mood/impulsivity/sleep.

ingredients.mechanism: Provides L-DOPA → dopamine pathway support; can be powerful, but tolerance and side effects are real.
label_check: Require L-DOPA standardization; avoid daily long-term; cycle.
risks: Nausea, anxiety, dyskinesia-like symptoms in rare sensitive cases; impulsivity.
interactions: Dopaminergic meds; psychiatric conditions: caution; serotonergic meds: caution.

dose_range.note: not a supplement; engine logic note

ingredients.mechanism: Engine logic: default to citicoline over alpha-GPC unless explicit reason and low CV risk profile.
Mitochondrial + acetyl donor; cognition and fatigue support; some depression data (esp older).
label_check: Prefer acetyl form for brain targets.
risks: Restlessness in sensitive users.

cycle.notes: Cycle to reduce overstimulation and habituation.

ingredients.mechanism: Adaptogenic and cognitive performance support; can improve fatigue and subjective vitality; quality/standardization crucial.
label_check: Require ginsenosides standardization.
risks: Insomnia if late; BP changes in sensitive.

ingredients.mechanism: Modulates monoamines and inflammatory/oxidative pathways; meta-analyses show similar symptom reduction to SSRIs in several mild–moderate depression trials.
label_check: Must be standardized extract, not culinary powder.

ingredients.mechanism: Gut–brain axis modulation; meta-analyses suggest modest improvements in depressive symptoms in some groups; strain-specific effects vary.
label_check: Must list strains and CFU at end-of-shelf-life; avoid 'probiotic blend' with no details.
risks: Bloating early; immunocompromised caution.

dose_range.note: pre-bed; do NOT combine with serotonergic meds

ingredients.mechanism: Serotonin precursor; can help sleep/mood in some contexts but interaction risk is the main limiter.
label_check: Hard-block if serotonergic meds present; start low; avoid stacking with other serotonin boosters.
risks: Nausea; serotonin toxicity risk in combinations.
refs: NIH/clinical references on serotonin syndrome risk

ingredients.mechanism: Potential neuroprotective signaling; supplement-level evidence limited. Treat as advanced, not casual.
label_check: Must specify ELEMENTAL lithium. Avoid if kidney/thyroid issues or on lithium Rx.
risks: Thyroid/kidney considerations.
interactions: Diuretics/NSAIDs/lithium Rx: avoid; kidney disease: avoid.

dose_range.note: high-dose category for safety gate logic

ingredients.mechanism: High-dose catecholamine/endorphin modulation can be too activating; reserved for advanced cases.
label_check: Start low; don't jump to high-dose.

ingredients.mechanism: Supports cellular energy buffering; emerging data for mood support (adjunct) and cognition under stress/sleep deprivation.
label_check: Monohydrate only; dose in grams.
risks: Water retention; GI if dumped all at once.
